AnnotationLevel: Where would you like this choice applied?
CanPie: This player has the option to switch seats.

board.description: Describes the attributes of the playing surface

board>connect.description: Describes how the cells of the board connect to each other

board>connect>hex.description: Cells connect to each other hexagonally

board>connect>other.description: Cells connect to each other in a unique way

board>connect>pent.description: Cells connect to each other pentagonally

board>connect>rect.description: Cells connect to each other orthogonally and diagonally

board>connect>snub.description: Cells connect to each other in a snubsquare matrix

board>mancala.description: Played on a traditional Mancala-style board

board>shape.description: Describes the shape of the board

board>shape>circle.description: The board is shaped like a circle

board>shape>hex.description: The board is shaped like a hexagon

board>shape>oct.description: The board is shaped like an octagon

board>shape>other.description: The board has a unique shape

board>shape>rect.description: The board is shaped like a rectangle

board>shape>tri.description: The board is shaped like a triangle

components>simple.description: Played with simple pieces of uniform size, often stackable, sometimes with lots of colours

components>special.description: Played with specialized pieces, usually differentiated

goal>align.description: Arrange pieces into specific shapes or lengths (e.g., n in a row)

goal>area.description: Control more area (or certain areas with certain strengths) than your opponent

goal>breakthrough.description: Reach opposing home row or home area with sufficient strength

goal>connect.description: Connect designated edges of the board or areas

goal>cripple.description: Eliminate some critical majority or specific subset of opposing pieces

goal>evacuate.description: Evacuate your pieces from the board

goal>immobilize.description: Make it so your opponent cannot move

goal>majority.description: Have more pieces than your opponent

goal>royal-escape.description: Get a specific piece off the board

goal>score.description: Outcome is determined by score in some way

goal>score>eog.description: Have the highest score at the end of the game

goal>score>race.description: Be the first to reach a particular score

mechanic>bearoff.description: Players bear pieces off the board

mechanic>convert.description: Players can convert enemy pieces into their own

mechanic>coopt.description: Players can interact with opposing pieces

mechanic>differentiate.description: Pieces are differentiated in some essential way

mechanic>displace.description: Moves can cause additional pieces to move as a result

mechanic>economy.description: Players must manage some central economy

mechanic>enclose.description: Players actively enclose areas or pieces

mechanic>move>group.description: Pieces can be moved as a group

mechanic>random>play.description: Individual moves of the game include some element of randomness

mechanic>random>setup.description: Setup is randomized in some way

mechanic>share.description: At least some pieces in the game are shared by both players

mechanic>simultaneous.description: The game includes simultaneous action selection

ChallengeClock: The clock start time will be {{start}} hours, incremented by {{inc}} hours after each move, with a maximum of {{max}} hours.
ChallengeDescription: You issued a challenge for a game of {{game}}
ChallengeDescriptionAccepter: You accepted a challenge from {{challenger}} for a game of {{game}}
ChallengeResponseCommentHelp: Comment to challenger on your response.
ChallengeRevokeCommentHelp2: Comment on revoking your previous acceptance.
ChallengeResponseDesc: {{opp}} challenged you to a game of {{game}}
ChooseDisplay: Choose how the board should be displayed
CommentTooLong: Comments can be at most 4K characters
CompletedGamesHelp: To keep the dashboard manageable, games drop off this list 7 days after the "last seen" date. Click the Clear button to remove it immediately. New chat will cause older games to resurface, restarting the 7-day clock. Visit the Games page to access older completed games.
ConfirmDeleteSubtreeDesc: This will delete the current (explored) move and it's subtree. Are you sure you want to delete the subtree?
ConfirmMoveDesc: Are you sure you want to submit this move?
ConfirmMoveHelp: If you prefer not to get asked for confirmation, you can disable this in your user settings.
ConfirmResignDesc: Are you sure you want to resign?
ConfirmTimeoutDesc: Your opponent is out of time. Are you sure you want to claim the win?
DisableMoveConfirm: Ask for confirmation before a move is submitted
DisplayNameHelp: Your display name is the name people will see. It is distinct from the username you use when logging in. The display name can contain special characters like diacritics. See the terms of service as they relate to display names.
DisplayNameChange: The new name will only be used for new games, not existing or completed games.
DisplayNameError: {{name}} is not available, please choose a different name.
DurationHelp_one: This challenge will expire after being accepted the first time.
DurationHelp_other: This challenge will expire after being accepted {{count}} times.
DurationHelpPersistent: This challenge will remain available until you revoke it.
EMailCodeHelp: The login system just sent a code to the email address you provided. Please enter it here.
EnableMoveConfirm: Do not ask for confirmation before a move is submitted
GameIsOver2: The game has ended. The following players won: {{winners}} and {{lastWinner}}.
GoBegin: Show beginning of game. Keys: Home or 'h'.
GoCurrent: Show current position. Keys: End or 'l'.
GoNext: Show next move (and first variant if any). Keys: right arrow or 'k'.
GoNextVar: Show next move variant. Keys: down arrow or 'm'.
GoPrev: Show previous move. Keys: left arrow or 'j'.
GoPrevVar: Show previous variant. Keys: up arrow or 'i'.
HardTime: Hard time: the system will enforce time limits.
HelpClockHard: A player who runs out of time loses automatically.
HelpClockMax: Remaining time won't become more than this.
HelpClockSoft: The opponent must manually claim the win.
HelpClockStart: Time on clock at the start of the game.
HelpNoExploreTrue: Players will be forcibly prevented from using the built-in exploration feature.
HelpNoExploreFalse: Players may choose to use the built-in exploration feature.
HelpUnRated: This game will not be rated.
IncludeAcceptDrawOffer: a draw has been offered. Do you accept?
Level: Where would you like these colors applied?
NewsPreamble: The authoritative and most up-to-date source of Abstract Play news is on our Discord Server (https://discord.abstractplay.com). Please come join us!
NoExploreTrue: The built-in exploration feature will be forcibly disabled for this game.
NoOpponentMove: No games waiting on opponent's move.
NoOtherPlayersAccepted: No other players have accepted yet.
NoYourMove: No games waiting for your move.
NumChallenge: There will be {{num}} players in this game. {{players}}. Seating will be random.
NumChallenge2: There will be 2 players in this game.
NumStandingChallenge: There will be {{num}} players in this game. Seating will be random.
OtherPlayers: So far the following other players are willing to participate in the game: {{others}}.
OtherPlayersAccepted: The following other players have already accepted: {{others}}
PendingSubmit: Your move still needs to be submitted.
PlayersAccepted: So far the following players are willing to participate in the game: {{others}}.
ProfileAnon: Would you like to be anonymous?
ProfileAnonHelp: Being anonymous means nobody will know who they're playing against, and your completed games will not be attributed to you. As a result, they will not be rated. Even if you change this setting later, past games cannot be reattributed to you.
ProfileConsent: Do you consent to the Abstract Play's terms of service and the privacy policy?
ProfileCountryHelp: Tell people where you're from! You can enter anything you want here, but if you enter a valid two- or three-character ISO country code, the appropriate flag will be displayed in your profile.
ProfileNameHelp: This is the name others on the site will see. It can be changed later. It must be unique across names currently in use and those recently used.
PublishHelp: Publish the exploration you did during the game so that anyone can see it.
RatedGame: This will be a rated game.
SelectPlayerCount: Select a number of players for this game.
SelectSeating: Select seating, that is in what order players will start the game.
SoftTime: No hard time: a loss on time needs to be claimed by the opponent.
StandingChallengeDescription: Standing challenge for a game of {{game}}
ToSubmitMove: Go to the position you can submit

me.challenges: This section lists all the challenges you've received and issued.
me.completed: Once you've finished a game, you'll find it here. Games automatically drop off this list 48 hours after you last visited it. You can manually remove a game from this list by clicking the Clear button. If someone comments on a completed game, it will reappear on this list and will be bolded.
me.issueChallenge: This is how you issue challenges for all the various games. You can also issue challenges from the list of games or from any of the other list pages (like the ratings page).
me.settings: And finally, open your user settings to change your profile, notification preferences, and exploration settings. You can disable these tours there as well.
me.theirturn: If it's your opponent's turn in any games, they'll be listed here. You can sort this table too.
me.yourturn: If it's your turn in any games, they will be listed here. You can sort the table by clicking on any of the headers. By default, the table is sorted by time remaining on your clock.

play.board: This is the heart and soul of any game: the board. Click on the board to make your move. Helpful hints will appear above the move entry box as you do so.
play.boardbuttons: Below the board is a series of buttons that let you do things like rotate the board and take notes. Most important is the gear icon, which lets you choose alternative colour palettes and turn last-move annotations off and on. A colour-blind-friendly palette is available for all games! None of these buttons will harm your game, so click around and explore!
play.chat: The best part about playing games is the people you play with. This is where you can talk back and forth with your opponent. The user chats are gathered here for your convenience, but a list of *all* chats, including textual descriptions of what's happening in the game, is visible at the bottom of the screen. Remember that these chats are public. Please see our terms of service and privacy policy for details.
play.move: This is where you enter your move. Most of the time, you can make your move simply by clicking on the board, but some games have a move selection drop-down, and you can always manually type your move too. Helpful hints will appear above the move box as you enter your moves. One important feature to note is exploration. Before you submit your move, and while you're waiting for your opponent to move, you can make further moves to predict how the game might proceed and formulate your strategy.
play.movelist: Speaking of exploration, a list of all the moves made in the game is visible here. This will also include predicted future states you may have explored. When exploring, the current game state will have a box drawn around it. You can use the buttons above the move list to navigate. You can also use the arrow keys and the Home and End keys.
play.settings: And finally, open your user settings to change your profile, notification preferences, and exploration settings. You can disable these tours there as well.
play.status: In the status area you'll be told if any variants are active for this game as well as other game-specific data like scores or number of pieces in hand.
play.welcome: This is where the action happens! The play screen for every game is structured the same way. The name of the game will always appear here, front and centre, along with any descriptors like whether the game is part of a tournament.

Tournament.Description: These are recurring tournaments for any game and variant/s combination. As long as there is enough interest, the next tournament starts automatically once the previous tournament ends. Tournaments consists of divisions, with each division being a round-robin having at most 10 players. All games are played simultaneously. The time controls are: 36 hour increment, 72 hours starting time and 120 hours max time. After being requested a tournament is open for registration for 2 weeks. If after the 2 week registration period there aren't at least 4 players registered, the tournament is cancelled. Otherwise the tournament starts, and the next tournament for the same game and variant/s is opened for registration. The next tournament starts a week after the current tournament ends. You will be registered for the next tournament automatically. Players are divided into divisions purely by their rating at the time the tournament starts. The highest rated players play in division 1, the next highest in division 2 and so on. Players are divided into divisions in such a way that all divisions have approximately the same number of players. First tiebreak is Sonneborn-Berger, that is, sum of defeated opponent scores. Second tiebreak is rating at the time the tournament started.
Tournament.Duplicate: There is already a tournament for this game and variant/s
Tournament.Name: {{metaGame}} Tournament
Tournament.NoneCompleted: No tournaments have been completed yet.
Tournament.RatingHelp: Rating at beginning of tournament. Final tiebreak.
